utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got to tell you, the more I read about the primordial gravity wave discovery, the more excited I get.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know. Being an astrophysicist right now is like being a rock star.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Only without the sex.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, literally, none of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you think about it, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Meh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? This may be the biggest scientific breakthrough of our lifetime. How can you, as a theoretical physicist, not care about this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe it’s because I’m not an elitist. What I’d like to know is, how does this gravity wave breakthrough help the man on the street? You know? Who’s looking out for Joe six-pack and all his quantum physics concerns?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you’re jealous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would I be jealous?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe because the origin of the universe just got proven, the Higgs field just got proven, and you’ve been working on string theory for the last 20 years and you’re no closer to proving it than when you started.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I’ve had a lot on my plate. We happen to live in a golden age of television.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Excuse me, fewwas. Sowwy for eavesdwopping, but there actually was some big stwing theowy news today out of the Hadwon Cowwider.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? Did they find evidence to support extra dimensions or supersymmetry?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: No, but they did find evidence that you’ll bewieve anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you do that? You’re a string theorist as well.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Incowwect. I am a stwing pwagmatist. I say I’m gonna pwove something that cannot be pwoved, I appwy for gwant money, and then I spend it on wiquor and bwoads. Water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you think he’s right? Am I wasting my life on a theory that can never be proven?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe. But how great is Game of Thrones?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you’re up early.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I couldn’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I told you those Walking Dead pillowcases were a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that’s not it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is something bothering you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but you wouldn’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, try me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. I’ve devoted the prime of my life to string theory and its quest for the compactification of extra dimensions. I’ve got nothing to show for it, and I feel like a fool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. I get it. I mean, not all the jibberjabber in the middle, but I know what it’s like to put your heart and soul into something and get nothing out of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean your acting career?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your relationship with Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your failed attempt to go back to college?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I’m saying you and string theory sound like a relationship, and I know what it’s like to be in one and realize it’s never gonna turn out the way you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said Leonard, you said no.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m talking about other guys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Well, what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You have to have the courage to end the relationship. You know? Break it off, shake hands, walk away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know if I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know it’s hard, honey, but in the end, that’s how you grow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, have you seen my good inhaler?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Break it off, shake hands, walk away.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, how’s dating two women going?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Um, kind of hit a bump. When I was honest and told Emily she wasn’t the only person I was seeing, it went great. So I tried the same thing with Lucy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She had mixed feelings. But when I said, Emily was cool with it. Emily’s the best. Why can’t you

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Women. Who knows what’ll set ’em off?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: At least now I can focus all my energies on just one girl.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I hope I get to meet her as soon as possible.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why the rush? She isn’t going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She is. But I like that attitude.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, is anybody interested in my old string theory books?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re really going to do this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am. Yeah, Penny pointed out that what I’m going through is essentially a breakup. And according to Cosmopolitan magazine, one of the most effective techniques for moving on is to get rid of all reminders of the relationship.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re reading Cosmo?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. As it turns out, there’s an article on how to get over a breakup in literally every issue. Anyway, it suggests that I set these on fire, but the smell of burning books reminds me of church picnics in East Texas.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s just a doodle of a hyperelliptic Riemann surface.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Wasn’t that the basis of your postdoc fellowship?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was. This seemed so elegant at the time, but now I realize I was just a simple country boy seduced by a big city theory with variables in all the right places.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s going to be okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. As hard as this is, I have to move on. I can’t keep postulating multidimensional entities and get nothing in return. I have needs, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, you and Emily still together?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I spoke to Bernadette. She’s free tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, okay, great. But if we’re really gonna do a double date, then we have to go over some ground rules about Emily.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like when it turns out she’s made of rubber, I don’t say anything?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s very real.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s what it says on the box. Right next to dishwasher safe.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: See? This is exactly the kind of thing I’m worried about you saying in front of her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I promise I’ll be on my best behaviour.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You better be. No jokes about how close I am with my dog. Or the truth about how close I am with my dog.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No jokes about the year I took ballet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You took ballet?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: God, you never listen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure you want to do this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The magazine articles suggest that one of the ways to get over a breakup is a new look.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about your old look, well-groomed ventriloquist doll?

utterance.speaker: Penny (treating Sheldon as a ventriloquist doll)
utterance.content: Oh my God, I do look like that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You stop it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, how do you want me to cut it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, how about Bill Gates meets Nikola Tesla?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, business in the front, science in the back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Or I don’t cut it and maybe just style it a little.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m in your hands. Do a good job and I’ll tell you Cosmo’s ten dynamite tips to enjoy your PMS.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can you keep him quiet? Maybe jangle some keys in front of him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That doesn’t work any more. He just thinks I’m taking him to the doctor. So, now that you’re no longer invested in string theory, what are you gonna pursue?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, there are so many exciting areas. Black holes, dark matter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard was telling me about dark matter, but I didn’t really understand it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t feel bad. Neither does he.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you ever even seen a picture of Tesla?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It actually looks good, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose I could see myself in a scientific boy band. Of course, I’d be the dreamy one and the smart one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry I’m late. What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I gave him a new look. It’s cute, huh?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s cute. That’s the problem. I don’t need other girls to see him walking around like sex on a stick.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s right. I’m too hot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m excited to meet Emily.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Me, too. I just hope he doesn’t blow it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because he’s Raj, that’s his thing. Beckham can bend it, Ralph can wreck it, Raj can blow it. Look, I don’t want it to happen, but odds are he’s gonna find a way to… Oh, crap, I know that girl.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: In a bad way, very bad.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whatever you hear tonight, just remember I love you. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Emily, these are my good friends, Howard and Bernadette. Guys, this is Emily.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Have we met before?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, no. I, I don’t, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You sure? You look familiar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, you sure don’t. You I know, you I know, you? Total stranger. Even if you had yummy candy, I would not get in your van.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Did you go to that spin class on Green Street?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That must be it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Since when do you go to spin class?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow. Now who doesn’t listen?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, your food’s getting cold. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, looking through my textbooks for a new field of inquiry. Why do we have a geology book? Leonard, did you throw a children’s party while I was in Texas?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait. What’s wrong with geology?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me put this in a way you’ll understand, Penny. You remember how you explained to me that the Kardashians aren’t real celebrities? Well, geology is the Kardashians of science.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you considered studying standard model physics?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want me to give up string theory for something that’s less advanced? You know, why don’t you break up with Penny and start dating a brown bear?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Like you could get a brown bear.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve got a good job. I could buy salmon. You don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe you could make your new field of study the calculation of nuclear matrix elements.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please. If I wanted to take up a fad, I’d get a tramp stamp.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about loop quantum gravity?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Duchess, look at me. My quantum gravity’s positively loopy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s the duchess?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: One of the people that lives in his head.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I hope he’s this distraught if he ever breaks up with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, if he does, I’ll see if my bear has a friend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, have you ever considered not rushing into something new? I mean, why don’t you take your time, enjoy your freedom? Maybe something new to study will find you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s actually not bad advice. You know, I didn’t seek out string theory. It just hit me over the head one day.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How does that happen?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A bully chased me through the school library and hit me over the head with the biggest book he could find.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, how about we toast your newfound freedom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, normally I refrain from alcohol, but since my cerebral cortex is twiddling its proverbial thumbs, why not soak it in grape juice that’s been predigested by a fungus?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And you wonder why other children beat you with books. Cheers!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Emily, what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I’m a dermatology resident at Huntington Hospital.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mmm, and you know what that means. Someone’s skin’s about to be softer than ever.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: This is making me crazy. I know I know you from somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, uh, Howard was an astronaut. Maybe that’s where you saw him.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Wow. That’s amazing. What was that like?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was the most incredible experience of my life. Up there in the space station, you’re…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, my God, I remember.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can I finish my astronaut story?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It was four years ago.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: We were set up on a blind date.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You came to my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re saying it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wh, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll say it. I was on the way to pick her up. My stomach felt a little funny. When I got there, I asked if I could use her bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Please don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One roll of toilet paper and 20 minutes later, I was so humiliated, I snuck out the window and never saw her again.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You know what else I never saw again, my security deposit.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I tried to unclog it, but you didn’t have a plunger, and water was spilling out everywhere.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Right, just water.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, I have felt terrible about this for years, and I’m glad I have the opportunity to tell you just how sorry I am.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It’s fine. All my friends love this story. They call you Clogzilla.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Get it? Because you clogged up her bathroom like a radioactive monster!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I get it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, hey, it’s not like cotton candy comes out of you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, let’s get you to bed. You’ve had a lot to drink.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No more than Penny.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. Empty room. Empty room. Empty room. If somebody says come in, I’m gonna freak out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, Emily, why did you decide to specialize in dermatology?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I like cutting people with knives, and all the other jobs where you get to do that are illegal.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re kidding, right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s scary, but it’s a cute scary.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can I say just one more thing? I had some kind of food poisoning that day. Sure, in retrospect, gas station sushi, maybe not the best choice. Nor was climbing out your window and running away. But I think we can all understand how humiliating that was, and I’d really appreciate it if we could move on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, we moved on a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m just saying…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We moved on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. Fine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How’s your soup?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah, it’s all right. They could’ve filled the bowl a little more. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I need some fresh air.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Been there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no. What have I done?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not so good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you gonna introduce me to your friend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not my friend. Nothing happened.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. I heard you reading pretty loud last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord. Where’s Amy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: After she put you to bed, she went home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. I should call her and apologize. Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Apparently, I called Stephen Hawking last night.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: First new message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Hawkman. It’s your old buddy Sheldonoscopy. How come you didn’t pick up the phone? Oh, right. My bad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re awful quiet. Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not really. I had a bit of an embarrassing evening.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ugh. Me, too. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I drank alcohol and may have left an unfortunate voice mail for Stephen Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wouldn’t worry about it. He’s got a pretty good sense of humour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I hope so. What happened to you last night?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, well, turns out I’d already met the girl Raj is seeing when I did a number on her bathroom. And that number was two.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you know, I’ve always been a fan of a story told by Attar of Nishapur, about a king who assembled a group of wise men to create a ring that would make him happy when he was sad. And that ring was inscribed with the phrase, this too shall pass.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Hey, Cooper. I heard you dwunk-dialed Stephen Hawking last night? Classic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get out of here, Barry.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Whatever you say, Cwogziwwa.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Clogzilla. That’s pretty funny. I don’t think that’s gonna pass.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: It’s me again. I gave up string theory. You should give up black holes, and we can totally solve crimes together.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Do you know what’s great? Geology. Oh. Look at this geode. That’s fun to say. Gee-ode. Gee-ode.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Gee-ode. Gee-ode. I kiss girls now.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Hey, guess who I am. Beep bop boop bop. I’m you. Get it?

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Are you mad at me? Oh, no, you’re mad at me. I’m so sorry. Beep bop boop bop.

utterance.speaker: Answerphone
utterance.content: Next message.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Thiospinel sulfide. Thiospinel sulfide. That’s even more fun than gee-ode. Hey, did you see The Lego Movie?

utterance.speaker: Stephen Hawking
utterance.content: What a jackass.
